message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CC 

The paper deals with the problem of estimating an unknown probability distribution from i.i.d. samples, which is a fundamental problem in information theory (cs.IT) and machine learning (cs.LG). The PML estimate involves solving an optimization problem over the set of all pmfs, which is a combinatorial optimization problem that is closely related to discrete mathematics (cs.DS). The Bethe approximation of the PML estimate has origins in statistical physics, which is a field that is closely related to information theory and machine learning (cs.SI). Finally, the paper involves the computation of a random matrix with non-negative integer entries, which is a problem that is closely related to combinatorial optimization and graph theory (cs.CC).
